events.name: Aug Meetup - TagUI RPA
events.description: AUG MEETUP - we are having a small workshop on TagUI open-source RPA tool. To register your attendence, kindly use this registration page - https://www.aisingapore.org/event/tagui-open-source-rpa-workshop-4 WORKSHOP OVERVIEWAI Singapore maintains and develops TagUI – a Robotic Process Automation (RPA) software that can be used for automating user interactions with web browsers and other applications. Use cases include process automation, data acquisition and testing of applications. Key features of the tool include cross-platform implementation (macOS, Linux, Windows), integration with R & Python for big data and AI use cases, execution of automation flows in 20+ human languages or JavaScript, and visual automation with OCR support. WORKSHOP OBJECTIVEConceptually gain understanding of what RPA is all about, opportunities and challenges offered by RPA, current RPA technology landscape and where it is heading. Technically experience for yourselves RPA in action using TagUI open-source RPA software which is freely available for use without cost. TARGET AUDIENCEPeople with interests in digital transformation, process improvement, engineering etc. Ideally you would have already heard about RPA (Robotic Process Automation) or Intelligent Automation. Technical experience is not mandatory, though attendees with coding experience can try more stuffs. NOTE - please bring along your laptop (macOS, Linux, Windows) for this hands-on session
events.location: AI Singapore @ innovation 4.0, 3 Research Link, Singapore 117602

events.name: Coding practice session
events.location: The Coffee Bean and Tea Leaf, 8 Marina Blvd, Marina Bay Link Mall, Singapore

events.name: BlockFellows Singapore Hub Fundamental & Advanced Blockchain Programming #5
events.description: BlockFellows is a free global initiative to empower more people to be blockchain programmers and experts, by running fellowship programmes and meetups in city hubs around the world. The BlockFellows Singapore Hub, together with Ethereum Singapore, is running these meetups for a cycle of 15 weeks covering the material in the Fundamental Blockchain Concepts and Programming, and well as the Advanced Blockchain Programming fellowships. To be a part of the global fellowship programme, sign-up at https://www.blockfellows.io/ Fundamental Blockchain Concepts Session 5 – Ethereum and Smart Contracts: Enabling a Decentralized Future(21st July 10AM – 1PM)We will go through Lecture 5 of the Blockchain@Berkeley Fundamentals course covering Ethereum as a smart contract platform, and how it differs from Bitcoin. This session will bring you through the Ethereum whitepaper to give you an in-depth understanding. Advanced Blockchain Programming Session 5 – Web3.js Interacting With Ethereum and Building a Multi-signature Wallet(21st July 2PM – 5PM)Learn how to connect the front-end of a Dapp to the underlying smart contract, and gets hands-on building a multi-signature wallet! Please bring along your laptop, chargers and water bottle (if needed). Digix is a proud partner of BlockFellows.
events.location: BASH @ Blk79, #03-01, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, Singapore 139955
